SENT.plain: One hundred and twenty-four patients over the age of 75 years were assessed for the cause of their macrocytosis (MCV > 95 fl)
A definitive diagnosis was reached in 75/124 (60%) by non-invasive techniques
The remainder underwent a bone marrow biopsy yielding a definitive diagnosis in a further six patients who had an identifiable myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)
A high proportion of the remainder had morphological abnormalities which fitted with no recognized pathological entity
It is suggested that these may represent MDS in evolution
